means: （认为某事无关紧要，尤用于反驳他人的指责时）（口语）
[表示同意、赞成等] 好啦，就这样吧！停下！（停住）别动！

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些连接副词均有"因此，所以"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: accordingly, consequently, hence, so, therefore, thus
means: accordingly ：书面用词，强调根据某种原因而得出的结果，其前可用冒号或分号，但不用逗号。
consequently ：正式用词，侧重符合逻辑的结果。
hence ：较正式用词，指接下来的东西是理所当然的必需的东西，但强调其重要性。
so ：用于比较随便的场合，口语中多用。
therefore ：通常指引出一个推断出的必然结论。
thus ：多用于书面语中，可与therefore换用。

sentence.Network_en: Failure is never quite so frightening as regret do.
sentence.Network_cn: 比失败更令人恐惧的是懊悔。

sentence.Network_en: He plays some passages so slowly that they become lugubrious.
sentence.Network_cn: 有些段落他演奏得异常徐缓，听上去有些忧伤。

sentence.Network_en: Fresh fruits and vegetables are important and so is bran.
sentence.Network_cn: 新鲜的水果和蔬菜很重要，麦麸也是。

jx.jx_en_mean: (chiefly derogatory)emphasizing a large amount of something

lj.lj_ly: it's just so much ideological cant.
lj.lj_ls: 这些太多都是流于空谈的假话。

lj.lj_ly: the novel was not so much unfinished as unfinishable.
lj.lj_ls: 这部小说与其说未完成，还不如说根本就完成不了。

lj.lj_ly: there is only so much you can do to protect yourself.
lj.lj_ls: 你为保护自己所能做的只有这么多了。

lj.lj_ly: there is only so much you can do to protect yourself.
lj.lj_ls: 你为保护自己所能做的只有这么多了。

lj.lj_ly: she had put her hair up so as to look older.
lj.lj_ls: 她把头发盘起来以便让自己看起来更成熟些。

jx.jx_en_mean: an expression of acceptance or resignation

jx.jx_en_mean: indicating a particular but unspecified quantity

lj.lj_ly: so many hours at such-and-such a speed.

lj.lj_ly: he sat down without so much as a word to anyone.

jx.jx_en_mean: indicating that one has finished talking about something

lj.lj_ly: So much for the melodic line. We now turn our attention to the accompaniment.
lj.lj_ls: 关于主旋律就到此为止吧，我们现在把注意力转移到伴奏上。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English swā, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch zo and German so

entry.tran: 如此，这样(指已经提到的事)
entry.def: You use so to refer back to something that has just been mentioned.

example.ex: 'Do you think that made much of a difference to the family?' — 'I think so.'...
example.tran: “你认为那会给这个家庭带来很大的变化吗?”——“我认为是这样的。”

example.ex: If you can't play straight, then say so...
example.tran: 要是你无法做到诚实坦率，就直说吧。

entry.tran: 同样，也一样(指后者跟前者一样)
entry.def: You use so when you are saying that something which has just been said about one person or thing is also true of another one.

example.ex: I enjoy Ann's company and so does Martin...
example.tran: 我喜欢和安在一起，马丁也一样。

example.ex: They had a wonderful time and so did I...
example.tran: 他们玩得很开心，我也一样。

entry.tran: (表示两个事件或情况在某方面相似)正如…，也…
entry.def: You use the structures as...so and just as...so when you want to indicate that two events or situations are similar in some way.

example.ex: As computer systems become even more sophisticated, so too do the methods of those who exploit the technology...
example.tran: 正如计算机系统变得越来越先进，开发计算机技术的人所用的方法也日益先进了。

example.ex: Just as John has changed, so has his wife...
example.tran: 约翰变了，他的妻子也变了。

entry.tran: (指某一情况)就是这样，事实如此
entry.def: If you say that a state of affairs is so, you mean that it is the way it has been described.

example.ex: Gold has been a poor investment over the past 20 years, and will continue to be so...
example.tran: 最近 20 年来投资黄金的收益很差，今后仍会如此。

example.ex: In those days English dances as well as songs were taught at school, but that seems no longer to be so...
example.tran: 那时学校里教授英国舞蹈和英语歌曲，可是现在的情形似乎不再是这样了。

entry.tran: (向别人示范)这样，像这样;(用手势比划大小、高度或长度)这么，那么
entry.def: You can use so with actions and gestures to show a person how to do something, or to indicate the size, height, or length of something.

example.ex: Clasp the chain like so.
example.tran: 像这样扣上链子。

example.ex: ...holding the champagne glass with long red nails positioned just so.
example.tran: 手指指甲又长又红，就这样握着香槟酒杯

entry.def: You use so and so that to introduce the result of the situation you have just mentioned.

example.ex: I am not an emotional type and so cannot bring myself to tell him I love him...
example.tran: 我不是一个感情外露的人，因此不会主动告诉他我爱他。

example.ex: People are living longer than ever before, so even people who are 65 or 70 have a surprising amount of time left...
example.tran: 人们的寿命比以前任何时候都长了，所以即便到了 65 岁或 70 岁，余下的光阴也还很长。

entry.def: You use so ,so that, and so as to introduce the reason for doing the thing that you have just mentioned.

example.ex: Come to my suite so I can tell you all about this wonderful play I saw in Boston...
example.tran: 到我的套房来吧，这样我就可以跟你好好讲讲我在波士顿看的这部非常棒的戏了。

example.ex: He took her arm and hurried her upstairs so that they wouldn't be overheard...
example.tran: 他挽起她的手臂，带她匆匆上了楼，这样别人就听不见他们说的话了。

entry.tran: (在叙述过程中引出一系列事件中的下一件或说明两件事情之间的联系)此后，于是
entry.def: You can use so in stories and accounts to introduce the next event in a series of events or to suggest a connection between two events.

example.ex: The woman asked if he could perhaps mend her fences, and so he stayed...
example.tran: 女人问他能否给她修一修篱笆，于是他留了下来。

example.ex: She was free for five whole days, from Christmas Eve. And so she would be going to Charles, to join her family...
example.tran: 她从圣诞夜开始有整整 5 天的自由时间，于是她准备去查尔斯跟家人呆在一起。

entry.tran: (表示开始新话题、引入新问题或对刚说过的问题进行评论)那么，这么
entry.def: You can use so in conversations to introduce a new topic, or to introduce a question or comment about something that has been said.

example.ex: So how was your day?...
example.tran: 那么，你今天过得怎么样？

example.ex: So you're a runner, huh?...
example.tran: 这么说，你是个跑步爱好者喽？

entry.tran: (谈话中表示接受别人的说法)的确，确实
entry.def: You can use so in conversations to show that you are accepting what someone has just said.

example.ex: 'It makes me feel, well, important.' — 'And so you are.'...
example.tran: “这使我觉得自己，嗯，很重要。”——“的确如此。”

example.ex: 'You can't possibly use this word.' — 'So I won't.'...
example.tran: “你绝不会使用这样的字眼。”——“我的确不会。”

entry.tran: (表示某人说的话无关紧要)那又怎样呢？
entry.def: You say 'So?' and 'So what?' to indicate that you think that something that someone has said is unimportant.

example.ex: 'My name's Bruno.' — 'So?'...
example.tran: “我是布鲁诺。”——“那又怎样?”

example.ex: 'You take a chance on the weather if you holiday in the UK.' — 'So what?'...
example.tran: “如果到英国度假，天气好不好得要碰运气。”——“那又如何？”

entry.tran: (用于形容词和副词之前强调所描述的特性)如此，这么，多么，太
entry.def: You can use so in front of adjectives and adverbs to emphasize the quality that they are describing.

example.ex: 'I am so afraid,' Francis thought...
example.tran: 弗朗西斯心想：“我害怕极了。”

example.ex: He was surprised they had married — they had seemed so different...
example.tran: 他俩居然结婚了——这让他非常惊讶，因为他们实在是太不一样了。

entry.tran: 如此…(以致…);到…的程度(以致…)
entry.def: You can use so...that and so...as to emphasize the degree of something by mentioning the result or consequence of it.

example.ex: The tears were streaming so fast she could not see...
example.tran: 眼泪哗哗地流下来，她的视线一下子就模糊了。

example.ex: The deal seems so attractive it would be ridiculous to say no...
example.tran: 这笔交易看上去太诱人了，要是拒绝它简直是笑话。

entry.def: You use and so on or and so forth at the end of a list to indicate that there are other items that you could also mention.

example.ex: ...the Government's policies on such important issues as health, education, tax and so on...
example.tran: 政府在卫生、教育、税收等等重大问题上的政策

example.ex: The patient can have apples, apple juice, apple sauce, and so forth.
example.tran: 病人可以食用苹果、苹果汁、苹果酱等。

entry.tran: (指某事有一定限度，但未言明具体限度)这么多，这么些，到这种程度
entry.def: You use so much and so many when you are saying that there is a definite limit to something but you are not saying what this limit is.

example.ex: There is only so much time in the day for answering letters...
example.tran: 白天回复信件的时间只有这么多。

example.ex: There is only so much fuel in the tank and if you burn it up too quickly you are in trouble...
example.tran: 油箱里面的油只有这么多了，你要是太快把油耗光可就麻烦了。

entry.def: You use the structures not...so much and not so much...as to say that something is one kind of thing rather than another kind.

example.ex: I did not really object to Will's behaviour so much as his personality...
example.tran: 我与其说是反感威尔的行为，不如说是讨厌他的为人。

example.ex: A good birth depends not so much on who you are but where you are and how much you know.
example.tran: 好的出身与其说是取决于你的身份，还不如说是取决于你的生活环境和知识水平。

entry.def: You use or so when you are giving an approximate amount.

example.ex: Though rates are heading down, they still offer real returns of 8% or so...
example.tran: 尽管利率在下降，它们仍然能提供 8%左右的实际收益率。

example.ex: Matt got me a room there for a week or so when I first came here...
example.tran: 我初次来到这里的时候，马特找了个房间让我住了大约一个星期。

means.word_mean: 1. the syllable naming the fifth (dominant) note of any musical scale in solmization

sentences.sentence: "I wouldn't have told you this if it weren't so"

means.word_mean: 2. marked by system; in good order;
1. to a very great extent or degree;

sentences.sentence: "he stooped down so he could pick up his hat"

means.word_mean: 3. in such a condition or manner, especially as expressed or implied;

sentences.sentence: "They're happy and I hope they will remain so"
"so live your life that old age will bring no regrets"

means.word_mean: 4. to a certain unspecified extent or degree;

sentences.sentence: "I can only go so far with this student"
"can do only so much in a day"
"I was offended and so was he"
"set up the pieces thus"; (`thusly' is a nonstandard variant)

means.word_mean: 7. (usually followed by `that') to an extent or degree as expressed;

sentences.sentence: "he was so tired he could hardly stand"

means.word_mean: 8. subsequently or soon afterward (often used as sentence connectors);

sentences.sentence: "we watched the late movie and then went to bed"
"they said the car would break down and indeed it did"

example.en: I didn't flunk,but my record isn't so hot.
example.zh: 我考试是及格了，不过分数不高。

list.explanation: (表示对某事不关心，不以为然或对抗等的感叹语)那又怎么样？那又有什么关系呢?那又有什么法子?这有什么？

means.word_mean: （表示程度）这么，这样，那么，那样，如此

sentences.en: First, you turn the engine on so.
sentences.cn: 首先, 你这样开动引擎。

sentences.en: “He will go to Hong Kong.”“So he will.”
sentences.cn: “他将要去香港。”“是的, 他将要去。”

sentences.en: I am so glad that you have come.
sentences.cn: 对你的到来我感到很高兴。

sentences.en: The dog was hungry, so we fed it.
sentences.cn: 狗饿了, 所以我们喂它。

sentences.en: I gave you a map so you wouldn't get lost.
sentences.cn: 我给你一张地图, 这样你就不会迷路了。

sentences.en: I'm well and will remain so.
sentences.cn: 我的身体挺好的，以后还是这样。

jushi.chinese: “他去学校了吗?”“她是这样说的。”

jushi.english: “There is a bee in your tea.”“So there is.”
jushi.chinese: “有一只蜜蜂在你的茶里。”“真的有一只。”
